Definition: a unique string with no spaces or special characters that will be used as id in the website
Notes: must be unique in the project

Definition: the name of the corresponding file in the project’s objects directory.
Notes: Should have the extension (.jpg, .pdf, or .mp3), no spaces or special characters.

Definition: The YouTube ID of an item hosted on YouTube. This should be blank for all non-youtube items. It is used to access the YouTube API for images and video of the item.
Notes: You can find the ID of a YouTube video by looking at the end of a Share link, e.g. in https://youtu.be/CVXQ3X6Q8oU the ID is the string after the slash. Make sure this field is empty (no spaces!) for non-youtube items!

Definition: A name given to the resource. (OCA)
An entity primarily responsible for making the resource. (OCA)
Notes: creator/author of the object. Usually given Last, First, with multiple authors separated using semi-colon

Definition: A point or period of time associated with an event in the lifecycle of the resource. (OCA)
Notes: date of creation of original object, given in ISO 8601 format. In this simple project, please use only a single date.

A free text description or abstract of the object. Anything significant about the digital resource not covered elsewhere. Use standard punctuation and grammar to describe the item’s history, physical appearance, contents, abstract, etc.
Example: Black and white photograph of white pines in forest

Notes: topics represented in the object, should use a controlled vocabulary. multiple subjects should be separated by a semi-colon

Definition: A geographic location to which the resource applies. (DCMI)
Notes: spatial characteristics of what the object is about, subject-like locations and geographical terms.

Definition: A geographic coordinate that specifies the north-south position of an item's place. (DCMI)
Notes: lat should expressed in decimal degree format (rather than degrees, minutes, seconds), with 6 decimal points.

Definition: A geographic coordinate that specifies the east-west position of an item's place. (DCMI)
Notes: longitude should expressed in decimal degree format (rather than degrees, minutes, seconds), with 6 decimal points.

Definition: A related resource from which the described resource is derived. (DCMI)
Notes: a collection or aggregation that the item is part of, generally a specific collection and the source archives where the materials were digitized from.
Example: PG 5, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives

Definition: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context. (OCA)
Notes: The identifier of object in its original context, as it is labeled in the source collection.

Definition: The nature or genre of the resource. (OCA)
Notes: The general genre of object, using the DCMI type vocabulary.

Definition: The digital file format of the resource. (OCA)
Notes: Use for the digital format of the resource, form as an Internet Media Type (IMT) term. For multiple formats, separate values with a semicolon.
language used in the object, ISO 639-3

Definition: Information about the copyright of the resource. (OCA)
Notes: Free text description of rights status

Definition: Information about the copyright of the resource. (OCA)
Notes: A standardized statement URI from http://rightsstatements.org/en/
